snippet: A frenzy of construction is taking place at the once industrial Hudson Yards district, where hundreds of workers are erecting office towers, a hotel, a mall and residential buildings.
abstract: Redevelopment of Hudson Yards district in New York City, which is located west of Eight Avenue between 30th and 42nd Streets, is picking up momentum; long anticipated development was criticized for years as it seemed to fall short of what then-Mayor Michael Bloomberg promised, but developers have in past 11 months paid city $336 million in fees and development rights.
lead_paragraph: A frenzy of construction is taking place at the once industrial Hudson Yards district, where hundreds of workers are erecting office towers, a hotel, a mall and residential buildings.

headline.main: Redevelopment of Manhattan’s Far West Side Gains Momentum
headline.print_headline: A Spate of Construction Cranes Dot the Skyline at Hudson Yards
